data.text: Ye
For thou
¶ Thou shalt not eat any abominable thing.
These
The hart, and the roebuck, and the fallow deer, and the wild goat, and the pygarg, and the wild ox, and the chamois.
And every beast that parteth the hoof, and cleaveth the cleft into two claws,
Nevertheless these ye shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the cloven hoof;
And the swine, because it divideth the hoof, yet cheweth not the cud, it
¶ These ye shall eat of all that
And whatsoever hath not fins and scales ye may not eat; it
But these
And the glede, and the kite, and the vulture after his kind,
And every raven after his kind,
And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
The little owl, and the great owl, and the swan,
And the pelican, and the gier eagle, and the cormorant,
And the stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
And every creeping thing that flieth
¶ Ye shall not eat
Thou shalt truly tithe all the increase of thy seed, that the field bringeth forth year by year.
And thou shalt eat before the
And if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it;
Then shalt thou turn

And thou shalt bestow that money for whatsoever thy soul lusteth after, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatsoever thy soul desireth: and thou shalt eat there before the
And the Levite that
¶ At the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithe of thine increase the same year, and shalt lay
And the Levite, (because he hath no part nor inheritance with thee,) and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, which
